column6: No comment
No comment
No comment

Wow. One of the best meals I've had in the city in a while. The family platter for 4 was more than enough food for a group of 5. The proteins (chicken, beef, lamb chops) were so flavorful and juicy. The veggies and the salads were also very fresh. There is a bit of a wait here despite having a reservation. But, it was worth the wait!
No comment
No comment
No comment

Last minute cancellation resulted in walk in to Salma. Without scanning the menu I was pretty confident to try some mezze and a main to share. We got Kibbeh and humus which were great especially the kibbeh which were crisp bite size and tasty. We almost ordered another set!! After starters came shish tawook and falafel platters, both with rice, pita, fresh herbs and plenty of red onions and garlicky toum.  We tore thin pita up to make our own wraps with shish stuffed with vegg and bathed in toum.  Will have to come back and taste shawarma and mixed grill as recommended by staff.
No comment
Shawarma was dry. Service was slow even though there wasn't that many people around. Ambiance is nice though.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
A friendly quaint restaurant with walk in seating. The food is plentiful but was little over cooked and could have had a bit more flavor. The kebabs seem better than the shawarma

This little quaint Lebanese gem in the heart of east village was honestly hands down one of the best restaurant experiences I have had since living in nyc the past several years. The food brought tears to my eyes, the atmosphere was intimate and it felt like family. If you live in nyc then I highly recommend coming to Salma and experiencing a true piece of Lebanon right here in New York.
No comment

the cutest little lebanese place in east village! We ordered the appetizer combo (pictured) and everything was absolutely delicious. Fresh pita, hummus, falafel, mousaka? Not sure how to spell that, and stuffed grape leaves. It was so delicious but that plus the falafel sandwich was so much food i couldnt finish it! A great problem to have especially when the price point also is extremely fair. When we didnt finish the manager/ owner came out and asked if he could fix something for us! Truly a great place and will be back!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Fire experience. Great food, interior, music and service. Very authentic. Great spot for a date, to take your mom to or bring your homies. Brick interior filled with indoor plants is very classic, food is super fresh. Tabbouleh was very very very good. Would for sure come back to this fine establishment.

I had such a lovely experience at Salma! I met up with a friend for brunch on a rainy Saturday afternoon and lingered for far too long waiting for the rain to dissipate. The service and food were great. We ordered the appetizer platter to share and I had a lamb shawarma. Everything was super fresh and halal. We had the pleasure of meeting the owner, who made sure we enjoyed everything we ordered and was willing to switch dishes if we were even the slightest bit unsatisfied. Luckily, we were happy with what we ordered. I'd definitely come back to try more!

Some of the best Middle Eastern food I've ever had! I got the appetizer platter, and it was enough for me to have a whole other meal from the leftovers. Everything tastes fresh, the labneh is delicious, and the fresh squeezed pineapple lemonade was perfect. I'll definitely be back!

tastiest lamb that Ive ever had. Lamb chops made me cry tears of joy, and so delicious. Grape leaves 'dolma' was just bursting with flavor. everything was fresh, especially taboule. excellent food and great to share with friends!
No comment

My friend and I walked by this place and decided to give it a shot because of the nice atmosphere, and I'm so glad we did! Everything we had was delicious, and the owners are also extremely friendly.  I would highly recommend getting the Moutabal (a roasted eggplant dip)! I usually prefer hummus over eggplant dips, but this one was the exception (SO good). The falafel was also great!
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment
Food was bland service very slow and prices went up by about 20 percent so I dunno..... Not worth coming to
No comment
As a middle eastern I am very disappointed with this restaurant. Not sure why it has such good reviews. Besides humus everything was unflavorful, overcooked and just poor quality. Do not recommend

I firmly believe that one can infuse love into their food. Taking care to make sure every element is on point. The atmosphere distinct with a warm friendly aura. Music native to the Lebanese cuisine just loud enough to buoy the experience to another level. The staff was friendly and quick to please. And then the food-- Pierre, the owner, has put everything into the food. His love. His passion. His soul. If you want to be transported to a beautiful place, eat here. We got the mixed grill and the mixed appetizers. That is a great combo to try it all. This is a must for East Villagers and those who pass by these gates of Heaven.
No comment

Amazing food, the freshest I've had in an NYC restaurant! Phenomenal service, attention and care! They are really sweet here and make you feel extremely welcome. The prices are very fair. The space is clean and alluring. I have only great things to say. You must experience this for yourself, because you deserve nice  things.

Wow. Just left here. Debbie was welcoming and patient. The service was prompt but not pressing. The food was tasty and filled me with love. Pierre's charm was the cherry on top. Try the Moutabal Eggplant. I also scraped my plate of Fattouch salad clean. The after-dinner tea was a perfect night cap for my evening. Seems like my mood has improved since visiting. Can you tell? Enjoy!

Amazing place amazing flavors and an amazing owner. Everything was so fresh and full of flavor. The hummus was smooth and perfectly balanced. We also ordered lamb chop platter and it was cooked to perfection. Salma is a great place to have breakfast and brunch if you are unsure of what to have for breakfast. I highly recommend this place.

Such a romantic and charming small restaurant. The place was packed after we sat down. Luckily we made reservations. The house salad was to die for! Love the pomegranate dressing. The grill steak was tender and flavorful. The sharing sampler was huge. Will definitely come again.
No comment
Amazing food, charming owner, reasonable prices.  I live nearby and think this is worthy of being in my regular rotation.
Can't believe it took me this long to try this place! Felt like I was a guest at a family friend's home  great people and great food!

This is my second time at Salma, and I can now officially say it the best. The food is incredible, we love to start with the dips. The labaneh is a favorite. What makes this place so special is the staff and atmosphere. The lighting is perfect, it's never noisy or loud. The owners are so kind and take great care of every customer. This is my new spot whenever a friend comes to town.

I ordered the shish tawouk platter which tasted amazing the only thing I didn't like was the rice on the side, the grains of rice were tough and hard. My friends ordered the lamb/chicken sandwiches and they really liked it. The inside of the restaurant was filled with fresh flowers and plants and had a very cozy and warm feeling.

We had a party of 12, and everyone wanted a million things. Not only was the restaurant super accommodating of our crazy request, but they were also super patient. Christina is amazing and a true rockstar! She made sure we had everything we asked for, even when we asked to have a cake delivered for someone's birthday! The food was incredible! I will definitely be going back.

Amazing service and even better food. Drinks were always full, food was presented beautifully, and the taste was authentic. We sat outside and the vibes were great! Inside looked very comfortable too.
Amazing food and both the staff and the owner are delightful people. If you're in New York you have to try it!

Quite literally one of the best places I've eaten in city, maybe ever. They make their food with love and care and it shows. The chicken I got was so moist and juicy, 9/10 times I find chicken to be a little dry and this place kind of rocked my world in that regard. All the dishes are vibrant and thoughtfully put together, too, what a treat. Pierre  is also a genuinely kind and pleasant human to be around. Will 100% be back!
The service is amazing and extremely warm. The food is great and the atmosphere is perfect for a quick lunch or a late night family dinner.
Great food. Freshly made and delicious! Chill spot when you're not in rush. Will be back for sure.

This place is very cute and the food was delicious. Don't sleep on the kebbeh - meaty but light and so well seasoned. I could've spend all day eating the hummus here, and they are generous with the pita bread. I would definitely come back!

We came with a group of 11 hungry friends and left extremely happy. Some of the best Lebanese food in NYC. The owner is welcoming so it feels like a family dinner. I would recommend the falafel, the chicken, spicy potato, and lamb. If you are looking for a great night, Salma's your place!!
No comment
So, I'm visiting NYC.. and really enjoyed coming to this place.. amazing atmosphere and the food is very authentic Lebanese dishes. Worth the visit.

Such a gem!!! So glad I stumbled upon this place on yelp and got the chance to try. This is a really, really good find. Great ambiance, lovely owners, fast service, and really good food. I hardly ever go back to the same restaurant twice in NYC but I'll definitely be back here!
Delicious, fresh food, authentic Lebanese! The service is so friendly, the atmosphere is adorable and cozy. Must go!!
Great food and ambience! Polite and attentive staff that truly cared about the experience. Prices also very reasonable
Phenomenal food, vibe, service, everything. Make sure to try the fillet mignon, the tea, and all the small plates are amazing too.
New Lebanese spot with the kindest owners! Feels like dining at a family friend's home. We got the labneh, moutabal eggplant, kofta and lamb shawarma. Definitely worth checking out!

Salma is vibrant, authentic and flavorful Lebanese food! We walked past and saw a quaint awning with romantic lighting and stopped to look at the menu. The owner Pierre was so accommodating, personable and absolutely lovely. We will be coming back as regulars!
No comment
What fitness from the chef!! Probably best libanese I have had in a long time. I live in the neighborhood and love coming here with my wife and toddler. Such a chill atmosphere!

Food was ok. Ordered the lamb platter and it was dry. Owner was very nice and offered our table hummus (was on final receipt). Food took over an hour to arrive. There are better places to go for sure.
The food was just ok so I'm very surprised by the rave reviews on this site. It's not bad per se and the service was pleasant but it's hard to justify a return visit.

I am so happy we tried this place. Very cozy, full of the satisfying smell of good Lebanese cooking.  The taboo lie salad was so fresh and delicious.  The mixed grill was plentiful, tasty and perfect.  This will become a regular stop.
Me and my friend stumbled upon this place and honestly am at a lose of words. The juiciest chicken marinated and cooked to perfection!!!
Great food and enthuasim from the owner of the resturant. The beef and lamb are great and you must eat them while warm.
No comment
The ingredients are extremely fresh and everything tastes amazing! The staff is soo friendly and kind. No complaints!

Thank you Pierre, Jenny, and Katherine for an incredible Lebanese breakfast with Lebanese hospitality. The eggs were perfect, the chickpeas deliciously savory, the pita flaky, the labneh fresh and balanced.... All of it so satisfying. Above and beyond in an architecturally beautiful and intimate space. Did I mention the coffee?  Did I mention the soundtrack?  Count me in as a regular.
so so yummy, great prices for so much food, and lovely service! Also a very good spot for vegans. Already planning our next visit back.

Food blew my mind!!!! If you are a vegetarian you are in for the culinary experience of a lifetime. I put my dinner in the hands of Pierre and everything he served for the table was incredible. I could eat 10lbs of the spicy potatoes. Say less. Will be back. Everyone should come here!!

column3: Woodland Hills, San Fernando Valley, CA
column6: No comment
No comment

Really incredible food and ambience. Went for a dinner with my Lebanese family after reading the great reviews. They were thrilled and I can say we all loved the food. Very reminiscent of the homemade dishes, with the same level of love and care put into all of the food. The owner and his wife are very kind people. We ordered the mixed mezze and mixed grill, and the portions were huge. It is BYOB as well!

Super cute and cozy Lebanese place in East Village. Owner was really friendly and attentive, food was delicious and felt very authentic, and overall great vibe w decor and beautiful bowls. The falafel (not pictured) was incredible!!!

Found a new halal restaurant in the area with the lady so we decided to try it and were very happy with our experience. The chicken and kofta platters were delicious, the ambiance was home-like with the plants placed everywhere, and the owner was very friendly. We finished our lunch with delicious baklava. Will definitely be coming back!
As a lebanese, it is hard to find authentic food but this is the place!! Everything tastes wonderful and we come here every week. Totally recommend the kibbeh & tabbouleh & mutabal & everything else!
Went with some Friends last night the lamb is to die for and the service is great!
Had better Kaftas at food carts. Not worth the price. Sauces were acidic, and was bread stale, just as a previous reviewer mentioned.
Love the friendly vibes and the food is amazing!!! Such a nice owner! Definitely will come back here
No comment

Salma is one of my favorite restaurants in NYC. The food was amazing and so fairly priced. The person who served our table was friendly and had great recommendations from the menu. We left so full of great food and happy from the amazing experience. 10/10 recommend and definitely will be coming back regularly!!
No comment

What an incredible place! We had the most delicious and authentic Lebanese meal. The owner Pierre is so warm and welcoming. This is clearly our new favorite middle eastern restaurant in NYC. All the food is carefully prepared and made to order. Meats are thoroughly marinated and the dish is full of different flavors. They handpick seasonal and healthy ingredients so everything is fresh and delicious. Can't wait to try absolutely everything on the menu.

This place is incredible all around. It's unassuming but delivers excellent service, a really charming atmosphere and absolutely DELICIOUS food. I've been here a few times now and have ordered most of the dishes on the menu at this point and none of them have disappointed. Special thanks to Pierre, the owner who goes above and beyond to make sure every guest has an excellent experience. This is definitely a new staple for me!

My absolute favorite Mediterranean spot in the city. Came with a large group and the staff was incredibly accommodating. It felt like I was having dinner at a relatives it was soo cozy with incredible ambiance. The food was great and for the price, you can't beat it. Kikis watch out. I will definitely be back.
No comment
Overall amazing dinner. We stumbled on this place and will be back again. We got the family mixed grill and all of the food was very fresh and super delicious! The service is also super friendly.

My wife and I are big fans of Middle Eastern cuisine so we were excited to try Salma after walking by recently. We had the eggplant and cheese rolls for appetites and chicken shish and roasted chicken for entrees. Everything was very flavorful and generous portions as well. Staff and owner are very friendly. A welcome addition to the neighborhood. Will be back for the knefe!
Food and service were amazing. This is a comfortable spot with amazing, authentic food and a wonderful owner. I had a wonderful time hanging around here.

Perfect place for lunch with the ladies! Fragrant, well spiced, authentic, generous portions, and simply delicious! The business partners (Pierre and Debbie) were present and are definitely the hosts with the most. Great guidance on menu items, attentive service and the place is super clean!  Indoor and outdoor option available. Can't say enough good things about this place. Great addition to the neighborhood. I see lines forming soon once the secret gets out!

The food at Salma is very traditional and the prices are very reasonable. The food is DELICIOUS and this is a new, hidden gem. We went as a table of 7 and let the owner pick all of the food for the whole table, which was such a great decision because we got to try so many different things! So thankful :)

This place has delicious Mediterranean food. We had the mix appetizers and was so fresh and flavorful.  The portions were plentiful for 4. We were full before the entrees came. We also order the mix entree platter and it came with assorted meats. But the kicker was they had baby veal. OMG, it was so tender and mouthwatering. It also came with this garlicky cream in the side. I was full but I couldn't stop eating the garlic cream with the assorted meat. It came with a side of cardamom rice. It was a perfect match. What a great meal. It was all chased down with a mint tea.  When the bill came, we couldn't believe how affordable it was. Definitely go back again. It going to be our go to restaurant for Mediterranean.
No comment
No comment
No comment
No comment

Amazing customer service. I had ordered food via a delivery service but they never picked it up. I called the restaurant and they told me the food has been ready for an hour and bo one picked it up. The lady I spoke with offered to deliver it to me even though I was 20 mins away from the restaurant and it was around 10pm at night. She did in fact drive over to my location and delivered the food herself even though is it not the restaurant's fault. She went above and beyond to deliver the food and refused to take any money. Aside from all this the food is amazing. I always order food from this restaurant and it is exceptional. Highly recommended.
